alert.note: Alert for Cass; Sarpy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 10 at 8:21PM CDT until June 10 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Sarpy County in east central Nebraska... Central Cass County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 820 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Louisville, or 9 miles south of Gretna, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Louisville around 825 PM CDT. Murdock around 840 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Weeping Water. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Omaha.
